thread.title: James Bond gadgets that now exist in real life: in pictures
thread.title_full: James Bond gadgets that now exist in real life: in pictures

author: Telegraph Staff
title: James Bond gadgets that now exist in real life: in pictures
text: MORE... In the 1965 movie Thunderball, James Bond (Sean Connery) uses Q's Jetpack to escape from two gunmen after killing Jacques Bouvar, Spectre Agent No. 6. In 2008, Martin Aircraft Company of New Zealand created the Martin Jetpack, which uses a gasoline engine with two ducted fans to provide lift. Its design claims a 60-mile-per-hour maximum speed, a 5,000-foot flight ceiling, with a flight time about 30 minutes on a full fuel tank.
